timeline.body:
Hmm, seems like pollJob() call usually returns false if the job failed.
https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/2a4092dfb8c46408818402b1c4a09a8cd44e907a/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigquery/BigQueryHelpers.java#L260
timeline.bodyText:
Hmm, seems like pollJob() call usually returns false if the job failed.

timeline.bodyHTML:
Hmm, seems like pollJob() call usually returns false if the job failed.

beam/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigquery/BigQueryHelpers.java

Line 260 in 2a4092d

return false;
timeline.author: chamikaramj

replies.bodyText:
According to actual job logs, the most common reason is that the job hasn't started yet, which is this line:

  
    
      beam/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigquery/BigQueryHelpers.java
    
    
         Line 268
      in
      2a4092d
    
    
    
    

        
          
           return false;
replies.author: apilloud
